message:
ATTENTION!

If you play video games â€” please note that this tool works on AutoHotkey, which may be prohibited in games, including in background mode, due to players using .ahk scripts to gain unfair advantage over other players.

To avoid problems with game anti-cheats, it is recommended to disable all AutoHotkey processes before playing.

The risk is highest in the following games: Marvel Rivals, Apex Legends, games with BattlEye anti-cheat.

prepare.fonts_not_found:
Fonts used by the utility are missing from the system.
Close this window to obtain them.

update_repair.description:
Repair installation.

Are you sure you want to force overwrite the installed version of DSL KeyPad?

All custom files will not be affected.

options.update_found_legacy_files:
The installation contains library and/or localization files not used in the new version.

Would you like to delete them?

File list:
{}

remapping.description:
When remapping is enabled, all standard keyboard keys will be reassigned according to the selected layout except QWERTY/QWERTY. This setting may interfere with application bindings, such as games.

Remapping will be relevant for custom layouts.

When possible, it is recommended to use a similar system layout instead of remapping.

description:
Modifier keys such as Shift, Alt, Win, etc. have been abbreviated for compactness in the interface:

{var:LeftAlt}, {var:RightAlt} â€” left and right Alt.
{var:LeftShift}, {var:RightShift} â€” left and right Shift.
{var:LeftControl}, {var:RightControl} â€” left and right Ctrl.
{var:Window} â€” Win key.
{var:CapsLock} â€” CapsLock in active state.

Interface:
{var:RightControl} F9 â€” open settings window
{var:Window}{var:LeftAlt} Home â€” main panel.

Bindings and input:
{var:RightControl} F10 â€” toggle all bindings state (on/off).
{var:RightAlt} F1 â€” toggle â€œFast Keysâ€ state (on/off, saved to settings file).
{var:RightAlt}{var:RightShift} F1 â€” toggle input mode between {@default:unicode}/HTML codes/LaTeX commands.
{var:RightAlt} F2 â€” toggle {@default:TELEX} mode for Vietnamese.
{var:RightAlt}{var:RightShift} F2 â€” toggle {@default:TELEX} mode for Pinyin.

Other:
{var:Window}{var:LeftAlt} PgUp â€” open {@default:unicode} web resource for selected symbol.

Right-click on list item â€” context menu.
Double left-click on list item â€” open {@default:unicode} web resource for symbol.

Left-click on {@default:unicode} block at bottom of symbol preview â€” open corresponding web page.
Double left-click with {var:LeftShift} held on list item â€” add or remove symbol from favorites list.
Double left-click with {var:LeftControl} held on list item â€” copy symbol.

Right-click â€” context menu.
Left-click â€” open main panel.
Left-click with {var:LeftControl} held â€” open settings window.
Left-click with {var:LeftAlt} held â€” open custom recipes window.
Left-click with {var:LeftShift} held â€” open Alternative Input selector.
Left-click with {var:LeftControl}{var:LeftShift} held â€” open Glyph Variations selector.

For Russian language, the names of various symbols of one or another alphabet sometimes turn out to be the same, which is why extended Cyrillic letters had to be introduced to prevent duplication of symbol names and tags within the same alphabet:
 â€¢ â€œҪâ€ â€” equivalent of Latin digraph â€œthâ€ or sound [θ].
 â€¢ â€œҘâ€ â€” equivalent of Latin digraph â€œdhâ€ or sound [ð].
 â€¢ â€œҲâ€ â€” equivalent of Latin digraph â€œkhâ€ or sound [ħ].
 â€¢ â€œҒâ€ â€” equivalent of Latin digraph â€œghâ€ or sound [ɣ].
 â€¢ â€œЎâ€ â€” equivalent of sound [w].
 â€¢ â€œҚâ€ â€” equivalent of sound [q].
 â€¢ â€œԮâ€ â€” equivalent of sound [ɬ].

Combination: {var:Window}{var:LeftAlt} F
Most library symbols have their own tags, which are variants of the symbol name that can be used for insertion through search.
Enter the tag completely or partially (or entry name) to insert the corresponding symbol. You can enter multiple queries at once by separating them with commas. Examples:
 â€¢ â€œhellenic capital letter lambdaâ€, â€œhel lamâ€, â€œhel_c_let_l_lambdaâ€ â†’ â€œÎ›â€
 â€¢ â€œĞ´ĞµĞ· Ğ´Ğ¸, !Ğ´ĞµĞ· Ğ´Ğ¸â€, â€œlamb, !lambâ€ â†’ â€œğ”ğ¼â€, â€œÎ›Î»â€.
 â€¢ â€œreference_markâ€ â†’ â€œâ€»â€.

Notes:
 â€¢ The shorter the query â€” the less accurate it is.
 â€¢ The â€œ!â€ sign at the beginning of the query tells the search to use case sensitivity.
 â€¢ Simple regular expressions are supported, for example:
    â€£ â€œfut.*?\s+\S+alâ€ â†’ â€œášºâ€ (Hagalaz rune)
    â€£ â€œaz$â€ â†’ â€œá›â€ (Mannaz rune)
    â€£ â€œ^Ñ„Ñ€Ğ°â€ â†’ â€œâ‚£â€ (Franc).

When searching, you can specify the desired glyph variation by adding â€œ::<VARIATION>â€ to the end of the query, for example: â€œlat m::frakturâ€ â†’ â€œğ”â€.

The search field supports the ability to call some functions and methods, including:
 â€¢ â€œ\â€ or â€œ/Reloadâ€ â€” restart the program.
 â€¢ â€œ/Exitâ€ â€” close the program.
 â€¢ â€œ/ChrLib.Printâ€ â€” generate and open .HTML file with library symbols list.
 â€¢ â€œ/MyRecipes.Updateâ€ â€” re-initialize custom recipes.
 â€¢ â€œ/Update.Getâ€ or â€œ/Update.Repairâ€ â€” get update or repair current version.
 â€¢ â€œ/KbdBinder.Initâ€ â€” re-initialize layouts and bindings.

Smelts a sequence (â€œrecipeâ€) of some symbols into others.
Divided into two usage methods â€” through an input dialog and through â€œComposition modeâ€, activated directly in the input field with the {var:RightAlt}Ã—2 combination.

Examples: â€œAEâ€ â†’ â€œÃ†â€, â€œAâ—ŒÌ†â—ŒÌâ€ â†’ â€œáº®â€, â€œBetâ€ â†’ â€œê´â€, â€œÎ£Î¤â€ â†’ â€œÏšâ€, â€œĞ†ĞĞ–â€ â†’ â€œÑ¬â€, â€œÅ¿Æ·â€ â†’ â€œáºâ€, â€œTHâ€ â†’ â€œÃâ€.

Notes on composition mode:
 â€¢ â€œPauseâ€ key â€” prevents automatic recipe processing.
 â€¢ Entering â€œ`â€ allows output to the composition mode field instead of sending to the active window, which will allow continuing the sequence after processing.
 â€¢ Starting input with â€œA+/Ğ+/Î‘+â€ (aĞ°Î±) or â€œU+/Ğ®+/Î¥+â€ (uÑÏ…) â€” allows entering symbols by their Alt code or Unicode code point (multiple values can be entered by separating them with a space). Alt code ranges 128â€“255 and 0128â€“0255 change code pages depending on keyboard language.
 â€¢ â€œEnterâ€ key â€” confirm input if pause mode or A+/U+ is active.
 â€¢ â€œInsertâ€ key â€” insert clipboard contents.
 â€¢ Starting with â€œ(<Number>) â€ the input result will repeat the specified number of times, â€œ(4) Upsâ€ â†’ â€œÆ±Æ±Æ±Æ±â€.
 â€¢ Starting with â€œ(~) â€ allows entering whole words, â€œ(~) Raâ—ŒÌ‚vnaâ—ŒÌ†, Sâ—ŒÌ¦timatâ—ŒÌ¦iâ€ â†’ â€œRÃ¢vnÄƒ, È˜timaÈ›iâ€.
 â€¢ â€œ(<Number>~) â€ â€” combination of the two previous points.
 â€¢ Using â€œ##â€ with â€œ(~)â€ allows escaping unwanted combinations (thoâ—ŒÌrr, t##hoâ—ŒÌrr â†’ Ã¾Ã³rr, thÃ³rr).
Combination: {var:Window}{var:LeftAlt} S

Opens a selector with a list of alternative input modes available for activation, representing an additional layer of bindings for various forms of writing, alphabets. Incompatible with {@default:TELEX}-like input mode.
Combination: {var:Window}{var:LeftAlt} A

Opens a selector with a list of glyph variation modes available for activation, representing â€œrulesâ€ that tell the program to send the specified variant of a symbol instead of the symbol itself, if the variant is registered for the symbol.

Facilitates input of target languages by implementing behavior based on TELEX and VNI layouts of Vietnamese language. Incompatible with alternative input modes.

Combinations:
{var:Window}{var:LeftAlt} D â€” open general selector.
{var:RightAlt} F2 â€” activate mode for Vietnamese and Jarai languages.
{var:RightAlt}{var:RightShift} F2 â€” activate mode for Pinyin.

Combinations:
{var:Window}{var:LeftAlt} â†‘ and â†“ â€” create bindings for entering digits in superscript and subscript (Â¹Â²Â³â´âµâ¶â·â¸â¹â°â»â¼â½â¾â‚â‚‚â‚ƒâ‚„â‚…â‚†â‚‡â‚ˆâ‚‰â‚€â‚‹â‚Œâ‚â‚), while CapsLock activation inverts the index.

Combination:
{var:Window}{var:LeftAlt}{var:RightShift} â†‘ â€” activates Roman numeral input.
LaTeX
Input in format $><LaTeX-command>$ is automatically replaced with the corresponding code symbol, if registered, for example: $>\bar{\AE}$ â†’ Ç¢.

Input format: \{U+200B}tcalc{<FROM><TO>}
Activates value input for temperature conversion from one scale to another. Examples: \{U+200B}tcalc{cf} â†’ âˆ’12 â†’ 10.40 â„‰, \{U+200B}tcalc{rera} â†’ 44,05 â†’ 590,78 Â°R.

The following scales are available: Celsius (C), Fahrenheit (F), Kelvin (K), Delisle (D), Leiden (L), Newton (N), Wedgwood (W), Rankine (RA), RÃ©aumur (RE), RÃ¸mer (RO), Dalton (Da).

Format variants are available, selected when specifying the fractional part:
{U+2003}<Integer>.<Fractional> â†’ 999,727.59 â„ƒ
{U+2003}<Integer>,<Fractional> â†’ 999 727,59 â„ƒ
{U+2003}<Integer>.,<Fractional> â†’ 999.727,59 â„ƒ
{U+2003}<Integer>..<Fractional> â†’ 999 727.59 â„ƒ
{U+2003}<Integer>{U+0027}<Fractional> â†’ 999'727.59 â„ƒ
{U+2003}<Integer>{U+0027}{U+0027}<Fractional> â†’ 999'727,59 â„ƒ

Active CapsLock before confirming input disables fractional part rounding.

text_processing.description: This category describes various processors for text selected in the edit field.

description: Combination:

{var:LeftAlt} 2 â€” encloses selected text in quotes. Sets different quotes depending on keyboard language and presence of quotes in selected text: ĞœĞµÑ‡ Ğ¢Ğ°Ğ½Ğ°ĞºĞ²Ğ¸Ğ»ÑŒ â†’Â ĞœĞµÑ‡Â Â«Ğ¢Ğ°Ğ½Ğ°ĞºĞ²Ğ¸Ğ»ÑŒÂ»Â â†’Â Â«ĞœĞµÑ‡ â€Ğ¢Ğ°Ğ½Ğ°ĞºĞ²Ğ¸Ğ»ÑŒâ€œÂ», Sword TanaquilÂ â†’Â Sword â€œTanaquilâ€Â â†’Â â€œSword â€˜Tanaquilâ€™â€, ÎÎ¯Ï†Î¿Ï‚ Î¤Î±Î½Î±ÎºÏ…Î»Î»Î¯Ï‚Â â†’Â ÎÎ¯Ï†Î¿Ï‚ Â«Î¤Î±Î½Î±ÎºÏ…Î»Î»Î¯Ï‚Â»Â â†’Â Â«ÎÎ¯Ï†Î¿Ï‚ â€œÎ¤Î±Î½Î±ÎºÏ…Î»Î»Î¯Ï‚â€Â».
